title: What is the difference between free Spotify and Premium? - Quora

response.answer_text: In addition to the different cost and functions between free and premimum Spotify account mentioned by others below, as an artist, if you want to boost the streams of your songs well, you need understand the nature of premimum and free account. This may help you: 1, The uses of them is different Premium users are music nerds, usually they want to be the first people to discover something new. On the other hand, free users want a much more guided experience and they are casual listener. 2, Traffic statistics from them are different You get paid whether or not a song is played by a premium subscription user, or a free user. The difference is where the money comes from. When an artist gets paid from a premium play, they’re getting paid out of the total bucket of money that they’ve collected from all of our premium users. When they get paid from a free play, they’re getting paid from bucket of money that comes from all of their advertising. Today’s free user, might be the tomorrow’s subscriber. Some listeners might start out on the ad supported experience when they’ve got say less cash to burn. 3, Listener experience is different With the free experience, there are some restrictions. Most of the catalog that a free listeners has access to, they can only shuffle through, so they don’t have as much control over what they’re listening to and when. Free users also don’t get some of the premium features, like high quality audio, unlimited skips, or the ability to save songs and play them offline. But they still get the most import feature for discovery: playlists One of the best promises about our free tier is introducing fans to the coolest most interesting, and the best music for them.

What's the difference between Spotify Free and Premium Price: With Spotify Free service, you get access to Spotify catalog of over 30 million tracks (supported by ads) on your computer or tablet at no cost. The Free tier is ad supported. And the Premium Spotify plan with unlimited access will cost $9.99 a month. With Spotify's student discount, you can get a Premium subscription in $4.99.  Features: With a Free account, you can listen to anything in our catalog, but you'll hear ads between tracks and there are some on-demand limitations depending on your device. With a Premium account, you won't get adverts or any limitations, no matter what device you're using. You can also access special features such as high quality sound, offline listening, and Spotify Connect. Streaming audio quality:	Spotify has three quality ratings for streamings, all in the Ogg Vorbis format. The choices are Normal at 96Kbits/sec, High at 160Kbits/sec and Extreme at 320Kbits/sec. Users with the free version will automatically get the Normal version, and Premium subscribers can choose at what level of streaming quality the music plays, but the Automatic style is recommended - it will change according to your network connection, with a minimum rate of 96Kbits/sec. Other Features: Premium's other huge benefit is offline listening, which allows you to save up to 3,333 songs each on three different devices. Any album or playlist can be saved for offline listening, and you can select the quality in which to save the music. Premium allows you to use Spotify Connect, which controls Spotify music across multiple devices. More info you can find Spotify free vs Spotify Premium, What is the difference between Spotify free and Spotify Premium
